items.title: Wonder Woman
items.description: Wonder Woman is a 2017 American superhero film based on the DC Comics character of the same name.

items.title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
items.description: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 is a 2017 American superhero film.

items.title: Baywatch
items.description: Baywatch is a 2017 American action comedy film directed by Seth Gordon

items.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales
items.description: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales is the fifth Pirates of the Caribbean film that was released on May 26, 2017.

items.title: Alien: Covenant
items.description: The crew of a colony ship, bound for a remote planet, discover an uncharted paradise with a threat beyond their imagination.

items.title: Everything, Everything
items.description: A teenager who's spent her whole life confined to her home falls for the boy next door.

items.title: Hell or High Water
items.description: A divorced father and his ex-con older brother resort to a desperate scheme in order to save their family's ranch in West Texas.

items.title: Zootopia
items.description: In a city of anthropomorphic animals, a rookie bunny cop and a cynical con artist fox must work together to uncover a conspiracy.

items.title: Manchester by the Sea
items.description: Manchester by the Sea is a 2016 American drama film written and directed by Kenneth Lonergan.

items.title: Arrival
items.description: Arrival is a 2016 American science fiction film directed by Denis Villeneuve.

items.title: Moonlight
items.description: Moonlight is a 2016 American coming-of-age drama film written and directed by Barry Jenkins

items.title: La La Land
items.description: La La Land is a 2016 American romantic musical film written and directed by Damien Chazelle.

items.title: Twin Peaks
items.description: Picks up 25 years after the inhabitants of a quaint northwestern town are stunned when their homecoming queen is murdered.

items.title: Game of Thrones
items.description: Nine noble families fight for control over the mythical lands of Westeros.

items.title: Riverdale
items.description: A subversive take on Archie and his friends.

items.title: The Flash
items.description: After being struck by lightning, Barry Allen wakes up from his coma to discover he's been given the power of super speed.

items.title: American Gods
items.description: A  recently released ex-convict named Shadow meets a mysterious man who calls himself "Wednesday".

items.title: Stranger Things
items.description: Stranger Things is an American science fiction-horror web television series.

items.title: American Crime Story
items.description: American Crime Story is an American true crime anthology television series.

items.title: The Americans
items.description: The Americans is an American television period drama series created and produced by former CIA officer Joe Weisberg.

items.title: Westworld
items.description: Westworld is an American science fiction western thriller television series created by Jonathan Nolan and Lisa Joy for HBO.

items.title: Veep
items.description: Veep is an American political satire comedy television series, starring Julia Louis-Dreyfus, that premiered on HBO on April 22, 2012.
